data.name: Compile-time maximum value in sequence finder!
data.description:
Given an sequence of values of type `T`, write a `seq_max_v<typename T, T Values...>` that gives the largest (a.k.a maximum) value present in the sequence.

For example:

```cpp
seq_max_v<int, -9, -1, 2, 3>;    // == 3
seq_max_v<unsigned, 0, 1, 3, 8>; // == 8
```

Also, note that `sizeof...(Values) >= 1` will always be `true` so you don't have to worry about something like `seq_max_v<int>` or `seq_max_v<unsigned>`.

**Relevant links:**

[Variable templates (since C++14)](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/variable_template)

[Parameter pack (since C++11)](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/parameter_pack)
